column2: 1. Do you represent a Cancer Centre or Unit?
column5: 2. Regarding staffing, have you experienced significant reduction in staff numbers in your centre from 01/12/2021 onwards?
column6: 2.a. Is this due to COVID related sickness and/or redeployment among junior doctors?
column7: 2.a.i. Please select the overall percentage by which junior doctor numbers were reduced to the nearest percent. For example, if junior doctor staff numbers are reduced from 10 to 7 (i.e. 30%) then select 21-30%.
column8: 2.b. Is this due to COVID related sickness and/or redeployment among GO sub-specialty trainees?
column9: 2.b.i. Please select the overall percentage by which GO sub-specialty trainee numbers were reduced to the nearest percent.
column10: 2.c. Is this due to COVID related sickness and/or redeployment among consultant staff?
column11: 2.c.i. Please select the overall percentage by which consultant staff numbers were reduced to the nearest percent.
column12: 2.d. Is this due to COVID related sickness and/or redeployment among CNS staff?
column13: 2.d.i. Please select the overall percentage by which CNS staff numbers were reduced to the nearest percent.
column14: 3. Have you changed the way your MDTs function due to COVID compared to before the pandemic?
column15: 3.a. Please indicate all changes to MDT functioning you have implemented.
column16: 3.a.i. If the number of attendees at MDT are reduced please select % reduced
column17: 4. Please answer the following questions about the proportion reduction of Gynae Oncology related activity compared to before the pandemic:
column18: 4.1.a. How much has theatre time reduced? - % Reduced
column19: 4.2.a. What is the proportion of surgical cases postponed? - % Reduced
column20: 4.3.a. How much has medical oncology access/capacity been reduced? - % Reduced
column21: 4.4.a. How much has clinical oncology access/capacity been reduced? - % Reduced
column22: 4.5.a. How much has theatre-based (intrauterine) brachytherapy been reduced? - % Reduced
column23: 4.6.a. How much have outpatient brachytherapy services been reduced? - % Reduced
column24: 4.7.a. How much has radiology access/capacity been reduced? - % Reduced
column25: 4.8.a. How much has pathology access/capacity been reduced? - % Reduced
column26: 4.9.a. How much has palliative care access/capacity been reduced? - % Reduced
column27: 4.10.a. How much have your rapid access referrals dropped by? - % Reduced
column28: 4.11.a. How much has your weekly MDT list/workload reduced by? - % Reduced
column29: 5. What proportion of your out-patient clinic is currently remote consultation?
column30: 6. Please tick all applicable boxes regarding PPE use in theatre:
column31: 7. Please complete the following boxes regarding patient pre-operative prep for major and minor procedures
column32: 7.1.a. Major Procedures - Duration of patient self-isolation prior to procedure
column33: 7.1.b. Major Procedures - Number of COVID swabs prior to procedure
column34: 7.1.c. Major Procedures - Are patients required to be vaccinated for COVID prior to procedure?
column35: 7.2.a. Minor Procedures - Duration of patient self-isolation prior to procedure
column36: 7.2.b. Minor Procedures - Number of COVID swabs prior to procedure
column37: 7.2.c. Minor Procedures - Are patients required to be vaccinated for COVID prior to procedure?
column38: 8. Which of the following activities have been moved offsite due to the recent surge in cases? (e.g. Independent sector)
column44: 8.6.a. Not yet moved but are planning to move activities
column45: 8.a. Do you need to go via a central hub or committee to access operating?
column46: 8.b. Are you currently working in the independent sector because you previously (prior to the current surge) moved activity to the independent sector and have not moved back to the NHS site?
column47: 8.c. When operating at different locations than normal, does your normal in-house pathology team report the specimens or are they reported by another team?
column48: 9. Are you working in a COVID-free hospital?
column49: 9.a. If no- Do you have COVID-free/green zones within the non-COVID-free hospital?
column50: 10. Are you undertaking minimal access procedures?

column30: Anaesthesia administered in operating theatre itself (rather than in adjoining anaesthetic room)
column53: I am proud to say in our unit which is part of Kings trust ( Princess Royal University   Hospital) we had access to day surgery 23 hours managed to do all minors and major surgery and some of them refered to local private hospitals which I managed  to do them .  But currently all service is inside only the patients whom were affected when they need center managment.  We never stopped any clinics virtual and f2f as well as MDT the only service mostly affected was and currently is colposcopy unit for diagnosis  Thank you

column53: We have continued to operate daily throughout the Pandemic  There is a central panel to decide priority for critical care beds - at present usually allowed one a day   A lot of work has gone into ensuring pts are ready for theatre to avoid any cancellations on the day and to ensure efficiency   In the earlier period of the Pandemic grade 1 stage 1a endometrial cancer patients were treated with mirena coils however this is not the case now - all listed for surgery if medically fit

column3: Royal United Hospitals Bath NHS Foundation Trust
column15: Undertaking virtual MDT
column30: FFP3 masks
column53: Chemotherapy services where provided the NHS by buying a private hospital, last year we did extra general and oncology gynaecology waiting lists in a private hospital, our two week wait referrals has increased by about 30% but most of that is GPs wanting to get general gynaecology cases seen urgently (it will be unfair to say they were exploiting the service but they are   referring stuff that’s obviously not cancer) and our managers increased our operating capacity acknowledging that turnaround times during Covid was much slower-we had 5/8 more operating Time, And this week we will be given an extra list per month to manage the increasing number of LLETZ. From a personal point of view, I am sad and other hospitals are struggling so much with reduced operating time But teams are not looking round the country to share out the workload to Services that  have plenty of capacity
